Risk Description: Malicious actor or insider gains access to Terraform state file containing infrastructure secrets
Existing Controls: S3 encryption (KMS), versioning, access logging (CloudTrail), restrictive IAM policies, MFA required
Notes: CloudWatch alarms configured for unauthorized S3 access; review CloudTrail logs monthly

Risk Description: Application flaw allows one tenant to access another tenant's data
Asset(s) Affected: Customer tenant data in S3 and RDS
Existing Controls: Per-tenant S3 buckets, database row-level security, input validation, WAF, code reviews, penetration testing
Notes: Annual penetration test scheduled; continuous monitoring via GuardDuty

Risk Description: Hardware failure or AWS service outage causes database unavailability
Existing Controls: Multi-AZ deployment, automated backups (7d + 30d + 365d), CloudWatch monitoring, tested DR procedures
Notes: Multi-AZ provides automatic failover (~2 min); backup tested quarterly

Risk Description: Distributed denial of service attack overwhelms application load balancer
Existing Controls: AWS WAF rate limiting (2000/IP), AWS Shield Standard, Auto Scaling (up to 10 instances), CloudWatch alarms
Notes: WAF metrics reviewed weekly; consider AWS Shield Advanced if attacks increase

Existing Controls: Least privilege IAM, MFA, CloudTrail logging, GuardDuty anomaly detection, quarterly access reviews, NDAs, background checks
Notes: GuardDuty monitors for unusual S3 access patterns; manual review of bulk downloads monthly

Risk Description: Phishing or credential theft leads to AWS account compromise
Existing Controls: MFA required for all users, no long-lived access keys, CloudTrail logging, GuardDuty credential monitoring, security awareness training
Notes: ACTION: Deploy hardware MFA tokens for administrators; implement IP-based access restrictions

Risk Description: Ransomware encrypts production systems or customer data
Threat Source: Ransomware delivery via phishing or exploit
Existing Controls: GuardDuty malware detection, immutable infrastructure (rebuild vs. patch), encrypted backups (daily/weekly), email filtering, security training
Notes: Backup restoration tested quarterly; never pay ransom policy established

Risk Description: Accidental or malicious corruption of Terraform state
Existing Controls: S3 versioning (rollback), DynamoDB locking (concurrent mod prevention), Git version control, peer review, restricted access
Notes: S3 versioning provides rollback capability; state changes require approval

Risk Description: Accidental deletion of KMS key makes encrypted data inaccessible
Existing Controls: 30-day deletion window, CloudWatch alarms for key deletion, restricted deletion permissions (ISMS Lead only), key usage monitoring
Notes: 30-day window provides recovery time; alerts configured for key deletion events

Risk Description: Failure to comply with GDPR leads to ICO enforcement action
Existing Controls: Data Protection Policy, GDPR training, DPIAs, privacy notices, data subject rights procedures, CloudTrail audit logs, incident management
Notes: Quarterly GDPR compliance review; legal counsel consulted for complex issues

Risk Description: Attacker exploits known vulnerability in unpatched system
Existing Controls: Monthly AMI rebuilds with patches, automated dependency scanning (Dependabot), GuardDuty exploit detection, WAF protection, Security Hub findings
Notes: Critical patches: 7 days; High: 30 days; monitor CVE databases and AWS security bulletins

Risk Description: Backups fail or are corrupted making recovery impossible
Existing Controls: Dual backup strategy (RDS native + AWS Backup), multiple retention periods (7d/30d/365d), quarterly restoration testing, encrypted backups (separate from prod), CloudWatch alarms for backup failures
Notes: Quarterly backup restoration tests verify integrity; success rate monitored (target: 100%)

Existing Controls: Multi-AZ deployment (auto-failover), AWS SLA (99.99%), monitoring AWS Service Health Dashboard, Business Continuity Plan
Notes: AWS historical uptime excellent; multi-AZ mitigates AZ-level failures

Risk Description: System capacity insufficient for user load leading to performance degradation
Existing Controls: Auto Scaling (min 2 max 10), CloudWatch monitoring, quarterly capacity reviews, RDS scalable storage, performance testing
Notes: Quarterly capacity reviews; CloudWatch alarms for high CPU (>80%); auto-scaling handles spikes

Risk Description: Security breach at supplier (AWS or SaaS) exposes EPACT data
Existing Controls: Supplier security assessments, AWS compliance certificates reviewed, encryption (keys controlled by EPACT), data minimization with third parties, DPAs in place
Notes: AWS security posture excellent (ISO 27001 SOC 2); annual certificate review; monitor AWS security bulletins
